data.title: By Far THE Best
data.text: Have lived in Arizona for over 50 years and have eaten many Mexican food meals.  This is hands down our favorite!  It is original to Consuela's recipes and even with the "diverse" decor it just is the place if you don't want to be disappointed.

data.title: Excellent food at a great price!
data.text: This is definitely a hole in the wall. It was clean, but beware that the chairs and tables have seen better days. We were only served the regular salsa in the cups. I didn't know about the spicier stuff in the bottle until I read some of the reviews here. Service was prompt, but not overly friendly. The food took quite some time, but it was the lunch hour. My husband had lengua burrito and it was excellent, super tender and tasty. I had camarones al mojo de ajo and it was very good, came out really hot, a tiny bit on the salty side. It is hard to find lengua anymore and have it served so perfectly. We will definitely be back as there were many things on the menu we want to try. I wish they served margaritas! That being said our meal was only $17.00, a definite bargain!

data.title: Lunch or Dinner
data.text: Love the enchiladas and chimichangas. The ambient is clean and very family oriented. Servers are courteous and friendly.

data.title: Very Good Menudo
data.text: We like Mexican Food and I was hungry for Menudo and this place was recommended to us.  Do not be fooled by the appearance of the outside or inside of this place.  The food was very good as well as the service.  The servers are nice and friendly and the prices are reasonable.  My wife and I really liked the salsa that they serve with chips--yummy good.  We plan to go back soon to try another dish.

data.title: Great food, reasonable prices, friendly staff
data.text: Outstanding Mexican dishes.. Red chili and tacos are personal favorite as well as the best beef soup I have ever had. This is a small hole in the wall restaurant, far from fancy but the food is excellent!

data.title: Fantastic Authentic Mexican Food... Great $$$ and Service
data.text: Must try for authentic Mexican food!  The location down in old Avondale is perfect, very kind employees,  free giant bowl of homemade chips & salsa while you wait and the large portions of food food are fresh, served very hot (warmth I mean... I hate getting cold food) and was extraordinary and a great price!!

data.title: excellent food
data.text: I took my 2 teenagers here. They loved it. The food was excellent. The chips and salsa were great. We will be going back.

data.title: Excellent Getaway Dinner for the Guys !!!
data.text: All the ladies were parting tonite so the guys went out to dinner at Cafe Zamora in Avondale, AZ.  Food was very good, especially the chips and salsa, flavored nicely with Cilantro and had just the right spiciness, service was very polite and friendly, overall shape of restaurant was very clean even though it is the old part of Avondale town.. Definitely would recommend one stop in for dinner, lunch or breakfast. Intend to take the ladies one night next week to so the new hangout.

data.title: Great food, reasonable prices, and friendly atmosphere
data.text: I met an old friend for lunch during a recent visit to Phoenix. Other friends recommended Cafe Zamora as a hole in the wall with great Mexican food. I couldn't say it better, although I will try in a lot more words. When we arrived, we were keen to catch up. The waitresses were keen to have us order, which made me wonder if they were going to hurry through the meal. No worries! We ordered lemonade to start and add chips and really good salsa.After about 15 minutes we  finally gave in and ordered lunch. I had carnitas.A healthy and delicious portion of pork carnitas with  flour tortillas, avocado, sour cream, lettuce, and tomato. Wonderful food and inexpensive. Even better, once we had our food, we were able to chat for a couple of hours. The waitress checked in after about an hour, asked if we wanted anything else, left the check, and left us alone. I was also impressed that the restaurant seemed quiet even while it was packed with a lunch crowd.

data.title: AMAZING!!
data.text: Great authentic Mexican food.. the enchilada sauce was amazing not to much tomato and perfect.. the salsa .amazing as well.. service was traditional and refreshing!! And the price is fair..a must try lunch stop..:)

data.title: YOUR TUMMY WILL BE HAPPY
data.text: We were in the area for business and decided to try Zamora for lunch.  WHAT A DELIGHT.   The owner was there and assured us we would be happy with our first meal.  The wait staff were sweet, pleasant and attentive.   We each had the enchiladas; I had the red...my wife the green.  YUMMY.  Lots of food.  The chips were excellent they are the thin ones (our favorite) and they brought as many as you want.  They bring two salsas: an absolutely delicious mild salsa in cups for each of us that are always being replenished and a squeeze bottle of spicy salsa that was definitely on the warm side which I thoroughly enjoyed.  It's a humble place that is clean with fresh food and plenty of it and with details like a stack of napkins and this enormous glass of coke that we appreciated.   These guys have it together.  You will not be disappointed.  WE WILL BE BACK for sure!

data.title: Great value! Needs liquor license.
data.text: Prompt service, clean establishment. The atmosphere is a little dated but the food is excellent. Hard to find a more authentic taste. Best value for my money of any Mexican restaurant I have been too. Bathrooms are very clean. If they could serve a margarita or a corona it be my favorite hands down.

data.title: Not fancy, but great authentic Mexican food
data.text: While on vacation, we refuse to eat at places we have back in our home state. We we're looking for an authentic Mexican restaurant and found this gem. While not fancy by any means, the young waitress had took exceptionally good care of us. The food was brought to us hot and was delicious. We will definitely return the next time we are in AZ.

data.title: Homey and good food
data.text: I was in the area and this looked good. It was a nice little store front and I imagined a comfortable ma and pa restaurant. It was nice, many choices Mexican, good chips and friendly service. I had hurt a tooth on way over so got soft tacos, beans and rice. It wasn't busy but bet it gets so. Reasonable and solid experience. Street address is 606 E Western Ave.

data.title: Real Mexican Food
data.text: If your looking for GREAT authentic mexican food, then go to Zamoras! The taste of their food is outstanding. Portions are large and the price is cheap! This is not a fancy place, but the food is second to none. My favorite is their chimichanga. Also when they serve you the chips and salsa before the meal, ask for the pico de gallo salsa too. It's not only good with the chips, but the meal too.

data.title: Modest Mexican food cafe in the heart of oldtown.
data.text: We have been eating here for more than ten years and have never been disappointed. My husband loves the #3 Chile Relleno breakfast.  The pork carnitas meat is very good, as is the green burrito.  Chips and pico de gallo are awesome.  Prices reasonable and food very good.  The folks who run the restaurant are very nice and efficient.  A hidden gem.

data.title: Great authentic mexican food
data.text: This resturant has great authentic mexican food and the staff is very friendly
